title: Everglades National Park: Directions & Transportation
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation             Directions      Everglades National Park covers 1.5 million acres of South Florida and spans 3 counties - Monroe, Miami-Dade, and Collier. There are 3 ways to access the park by car. The main entrance located in Homestead, Florida connects visitors to the Royal Palm Area and the Flamingo Area of Everglades National Park. The Shark Valley entrance is located in Miami, Florida and the Gulf Coast Entrance is located in Everglades City. Additionally, boaters and paddlers can enter the park through its coastal boundaries and waterways. Visitor Centers are located at the Main Entrance, Flamingo, Shark Valley and Gulf Coast.         Everglades National Park Ernest Coe Visitor Center in Homestead, Florida NPSPhoto  Click here for directions to the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center located at the Main Entrance of Everglades National Park in Homestead, Florida          Everglades National Park Flamingo Visitor Center in Flamingo, Florida National Park Service  Click here for directions to the Flamingo Visitor Center in Flamingo, Florida        Shark Valley Area National Park Service  Click here for directions to the Shark Valley Visitor Center.          Everglades National Park Gulf Coast Visitor Center in Everglades City National Park Service  Click here for directions to the Gulf Coast Visitor Center in Everglades City, Florida
